   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\n\r\nIs it possible to combine the Connect field on the tool bar with the Search field capability, so that when you type something there on the top field, it would filter-out connections in the list accordingly?\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nA user types in the name of the server in the filed on the tool bar (Could be renamed to 'Search\\Connect' or something more human-readable). As the user types in the name the list of connections fi...",

+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Valid UX suggestion to unify the filter and quick-connect fields into a single input bar, reducing UI clutter in the connection panel.\nApproach: Merge the filter TextBox with the quick-connect field into a single ComboBox/TextBox that filters the tree on typing and opens a connection on Enter; remove the redundant separate field.",

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionTreeWindow.cs b/mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionTreeWindow.cs
index 2a0c77719..a6bad3d2f 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionTreeWindow.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionTreeWindow.cs
@@ -359,6 +359,26 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.UI.Window
                             e.Handled = true;
                             break;
                         }
+                    case Keys.Enter:
+                        e.Handled = true;
+                        if (SelectedNode != null)
+                        {
+                            Runtime.ConnectionInitiator.OpenConnection(SelectedNode);
+                        }
+                        else
+                        {
+                            // No tree match: treat search text as a hostname for quick-connect (#1603)
+                            string searchText = txtSearch.Text.Trim();
+                            if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(searchText) && searchText != Language.SearchPrompt)
+                            {
+                                ConnectionInfo? quickConnection = Runtime.ConnectionsService.CreateQuickConnect(
+                                    searchText,
+                                    Converter.StringToProtocol(Settings.Default.QuickConnectProtocol));
+                                if (quickConnection != null)
+                                    Runtime.ConnectionInitiator.OpenConnection(quickConnection, ConnectionInfo.Force.DoNotJump);
+                            }
+                        }
+                        break;
                     default:
                         TvConnections_KeyDown(sender, e);
                         break;
